verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> of Asaph.<WH623> Truly<WH389> God<WH430> is good<WH2896> to Israel,<WH3478> even to such as are of a clean<WH1249> heart.<WH3824>
But as for me,<WH589> my feet<WH7272> were almost<WH4592> gone;<WH5186> my steps<WH838> had well nigh<WH369> slipped.<WH8210>
For <WH3588> I was envious<WH7065> at the foolish,<WH1984> when I saw<WH7200> the prosperity<WH7965> of the wicked.<WH7563>
For <WH3588> there are no<WH369> bands<WH2784> in their death:<WH4194> but their strength<WH193> is firm.<WH1277>
They are not<WH369> in trouble<WH5999> as other men;<WH582> neither<WH3808> are they plagued<WH5060> like<WH5973> other men.<WH120>
Therefore <WH3651> pride<WH1346> compasseth them about as a chain;<WH6059> violence<WH2555> covereth<WH5848> them as a garment.<WH7897>
Their eyes<WH5869> stand out<WH3318> with fatness:<WH4480> <WH2459> they have more<WH5674> than heart<WH3824> could wish.<WH4906>
They are corrupt,<WH4167> and speak<WH1696> wickedly<WH7451> concerning oppression:<WH6233> they speak<WH1696> loftily.<WH4480> <WH4791>
They set<WH8371> their mouth<WH6310> against the heavens,<WH8064> and their tongue<WH3956> walketh<WH1980> through the earth.<WH776>
Therefore <WH3651> his people<WH5971> return<WH7725> hither:<WH1988> and waters<WH4325> of a full<WH4392> cup are wrung out<WH4680> to them.
And they say,<WH559> How<WH349> doth God<WH410> know?<WH3045> and is there<WH3426> knowledge<WH1844> in the most High?<WH5945>
Behold, <WH2009> these<WH428> are the ungodly,<WH7563> who prosper<WH7961> in the world;<WH5769> they increase<WH7685> in riches.<WH2428>
Verily <WH389> I have cleansed<WH2135> my heart<WH3824> in vain,<WH7385> and washed<WH7364> my hands<WH3709> in innocency.<WH5356>
For all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long have I been<WH1961> plagued,<WH5060> and chastened<WH8433> every morning.<WH1242>
If <WH518> I say,<WH559> I will speak<WH5608> thus;<WH3644> behold,<WH2009> I should offend<WH898> against the generation<WH1755> of thy children.<WH1121>
When I thought<WH2803> to know<WH3045> this,<WH2063> it<WH1931> was too painful<WH5999> for<WH5869> me;
Until <WH5704> I went<WH935> into<WH413> the sanctuary<WH4720> of God;<WH410> then understood<WH995> I their end.<WH319>
Surely <WH389> thou didst set<WH7896> them in slippery places:<WH2513> thou castedst them down<WH5307> into destruction.<WH4876>
How <WH349> are<WH1961> they brought into desolation,<WH8047> as in a moment!<WH7281> they are utterly consumed<WH5486> <WH8552> with<WH4480> terrors.<WH1091>
As a dream<WH2472> when one awaketh;<WH4480> <WH6974> so, O Lord,<WH136> when thou awakest,<WH5782> thou shalt despise<WH959> their image.<WH6754>
Thus <WH3588> my heart<WH3824> was grieved,<WH2556> and I was pricked<WH8150> in my reins.<WH3629>
So foolish<WH1198> was I,<WH589> and ignorant:<WH3808> <WH3045> I was<WH1961> as a beast<WH929> before<WH5973> thee.
Nevertheless I<WH589> am continually<WH8548> with<WH5973> thee: thou hast holden<WH270> me by my right<WH3225> hand.<WH3027>
Thou shalt guide<WH5148> me with thy counsel,<WH6098> and afterward<WH310> receive<WH3947> me to glory.<WH3519>
Whom <WH4310> have I in heaven<WH8064> but thee? and there is none<WH3808> upon earth<WH776> that I desire<WH2654> beside<WH5973> thee.
My flesh<WH7607> and my heart<WH3824> faileth:<WH3615> but God<WH430> is the strength<WH6697> of my heart,<WH3824> and my portion<WH2506> forever.<WH5769>
For, <WH3588> lo,<WH2009> they that are far<WH7369> from thee shall perish:<WH6> thou hast destroyed<WH6789> all<WH3605> them that go a whoring<WH2181> from<WH4480> thee.
But it<WH589> is good<WH2896> for me to draw near<WH7132> to God:<WH430> I have put<WH7896> my trust<WH4268> in the Lord<WH136> GOD,<WH3069> that I may declare<WH5608> all<WH3605> thy works.<WH4399>
